document_info.title: Amor fati's Guide to Juremala (Mucosahuasca)
document_info.author: amor_fati
document_info.purpose: Sublingual administration of jurema extract with harmaloids
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents historical administration research.

juremala_definition.description: Character and method of administration unique to jurema-extracted spice
juremala_definition.method: Jurema extract used with harmaloids to achieve extended duration of psychedelia
juremala_definition.key_insight: Purified substances are far-cry from crude traditional preparations - alternative routes available

digestive_tract_problems.issue: Digestive tract is one of the most reliably INCONSISTENT factors
negative_factors: Time gaps between spice and harmaloid dosage

why_sublingual.solution: Subtract digestive tract entirely - absorb directly into bloodstream

oral_workaround.method: Mix substances in salt form into shot, take all at once
oral_workaround.theory: Good portion absorbed on the way down, rest shortly after
oral_workaround.implication: Stomach and intestines may NOT be chief absorption locations
oral_workaround.evidence: Reports of experience coming in waves rather than all at once

ideal_preparation.form: Small volume tincture with absorption-promoting substances
ideal_preparation.dosage_advantage: Far more localized absorption = greatly reduced dosage for like magnitude effects

analog_theory.observation: Reports indicate analogs most readily absorb through oral mucosa
analog_theory.practical_implication: Can remove pure substances for other use, leave analogs for sublingual

procedure: Add freebase to intended dropper bottle
Dissolve in distilled white vinegar (5% acetic acid) - converts to acetate salt
Shake vigorously and submerge in hot-water bath
Stabilize opened bottle as close to fan as possible
Refill with vinegar (pH 4 max) OR 50% glycerin/water to preserve and create tincture
Add fumarates to intended dropper bottle
Shake vigorously and submerge in hot-water bath

dosage_guidelines.tincture_advantage: Easier to measure - drops determine amounts by known concentration

spice_amounts.sublingual: 30-40mg full alkaloid spice acetate or fumarate

ratios.note: Less harmaloids necessary with stronger RIMAs like harmaline

common_mistake.method: Leave powder in pile or tincture in puddle, wait 5min in agony

step_2.action: Spread rapidly with bottom of tongue
step_2.benefit: Maximizes surface area contact, hastens absorption

step_3.action: Prevent saliva dilution - keep mouth as dry as possible
problems_from_dilution: Hampers contact between agent and mucous membrane
May wash substance too far into digestive tract

step_4.action: Swallow saliva before it accumulates, as rapidly as possible
step_4.note: Any agent reaching throat (oropharynx) absorbs there before reaching digestive tract

step_5.action: Refrain from drinking fluids too soon after administration

tincture_application.drop_sets: Apply in minimal sets of ~5-6 drops
tincture_application.speed: Each set administered as rapidly as possible

key_principles.spreading: Spread agent as much as possible upon application
key_principles.swallowing: Avoid swallowing tincture/powder as much as possible
key_principles.dryness: Keep mouth as dry as possible throughout

terminology.mucosahuasca: Absorption through oral mucosa (sublingual, buccal, oropharyngeal)
terminology.RIMA: Reversible Inhibitor of Monoamine Oxidase A
